io.hekate.messaging.broadcast

Interface AggregateCallback<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - Base type of a messages.
    Functional Interface:
    This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.

    @FunctionalInterface
public interface AggregateCallback<T>
    Callback for aggregate(...) operation.

    This interface can be used with the MessagingChannel.aggregate(Object, AggregateCallback) method and will be notified as follows:

    • channel submits request to each of the target nodes in parallel
    • for each failed submission the onReplyFailure(Object, ClusterNode, Throwable) method gets notified
    • for each successfully received response the onReplySuccess(Response, ClusterNode) method gets notified
    • for each response receiving failure the onReplyFailure(Object, ClusterNode, Throwable) method gets notified
    • when all results are collected (either successful or failed) the onComplete(Throwable, AggregateResult) method gets called with an error parameter being null and an AggregateResult object containing all successful and partially failed results.

    Note: Implementations of this interface must be thread safe since its methods can be notified in parallel by multiple threads.

    See Also:
    MessagingChannel.aggregate(Object, AggregateCallback), AggregateResult

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onComplete(Throwable err, AggregateResult<T> result)
      Called when the aggregation operation gets completed either successfully or with an error.
      default void onReplyFailure(T request, ClusterNode node, Throwable cause)
      Called in case of a cluster node communication failure.
      default void onReplySuccess(Response<T> rsp, ClusterNode node)
      Called after a reply was received from a cluster node.

    • Method Detail

      • onComplete

        void onComplete(Throwable err,
                AggregateResult<T> result)
        Called when the aggregation operation gets completed either successfully or with an error.

        If operation completes with a fatal error (f.e channel is closed) then err parameter will hold the error cause and result parameter will be null. Otherwise err parameter will be null and result parameter will hold the aggregation result.

        Parameters:
        err - Error (null if operation was successful).
        result - Aggregation result (null if operation failed).

      • onReplySuccess

        default void onReplySuccess(Response<T> rsp,
                            ClusterNode node)
        Called after a reply was received from a cluster node.

        Note that this method gets called while aggregation is still in progress. Final aggregation results are provided by the onComplete(Throwable, AggregateResult) method. See the description of AggregateCallback interface for the complete sequence of callback methods notification.

        Parameters:
        rsp - Response from the cluster node.
        node - Cluster node that sent the reply.

      • onReplyFailure

        default void onReplyFailure(T request,
                            ClusterNode node,
                            Throwable cause)
        Called in case of a cluster node communication failure.

        Note that this method gets called while aggregation is still in progress. Final aggregation results are provided by the onComplete(Throwable, AggregateResult) method. See the description of AggregateCallback interface for the complete sequence of callback methods notification.

        Parameters:
        request - Original request.
        node - Failed cluster node.
        cause - Error cause.
